com.panasonic.toughpad.android.api.smartcard

Interface SmartCardReader


  • public interface SmartCardReader
    SmartCardReader represents the smart card reader device.
    Use SmartCardReaderManager class to get SmartCardReader objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void beginExclusive()
      Requests exclusive access to the card.
      byte[] connect(java.lang.String protocol)
      Establishes a connection to the card.
      void disable()
      Disables the SmartCardReader.
      void disconnect(boolean reset)
      Disconnects the connection with the card.
      void enable()
      Enables the SmartCardReader.
      void endExclusive()
      Releases the exclusive access previously established using beginExclusive().
      int getLastError()
      Returns the status code of the last executed method.
      java.lang.String getProtocol()
      Gets the protocol used for card connection.
      java.lang.String getReaderName()
      Gets the name of the SmartCardReader.
      SmartCardStatusInfo getStatusInfo()
      Returns current status of the card.
      boolean isCardPresent()
      Checks if the card is present in card reader.
      boolean isConnected()
      Checks if the card is connected.
      boolean isEnabled()
      Checks if the SmartCardReader is enabled.
      byte[] transmit(byte[] apdu)
      Transmits the specified command APDU to the Smart Card and returns the response APDU.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        byte[] connect(java.lang.String protocol)
        throws SmartCardException,
               SmartCardNotPresentException
        Establishes a connection to the card.
        Parameters:
        protocol - the protocol to use ("T=0", "T=1", or "T=CL"), or "*" to connect using any available protocol.
        Returns:
        ATR of the card which the connection is established.
        Throws:
        SmartCardNotPresentException - if no card is present in the card reader
        SmartCardException - if a connection could not be established using the specified protocol or if a connection has previously been established using a different protocol
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if protocol is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if protocol is an invalid protocol specification
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a SecurityManager exists and the caller does not have the required permission

      • disconnect

        void disconnect(boolean reset)
         throws SmartCardException
        Disconnects the connection with the card.
        Parameters:
        reset - whether to reset the card after disconnecting.
        Throws:
        SmartCardException - if the card operation failed
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a SecurityManager exists and the caller does not have the required permission

      • isCardPresent

        boolean isCardPresent()
               throws SmartCardException
        Checks if the card is present in card reader.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the card is present, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        SmartCardException - if the status could not be determined

      • getProtocol

        java.lang.String getProtocol()
        Gets the protocol used for card connection.
        Returns:
        the protocol used for the current connection, for example "T=0" or "T=1".

      • transmit

        byte[] transmit(byte[] apdu)
         throws SmartCardException
        Transmits the specified command APDU to the Smart Card and returns the response APDU.
        Parameters:
        apdu - the command APDU.
        Returns:
        the response APDU received from the card.
        Throws:
        SmartCardException - if the card operation failed
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if command is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the APDU encodes a MANAGE CHANNEL command
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if connection has been closed or if the corresponding Card has been disconnected

      • beginExclusive

        void beginExclusive()
             throws SmartCardException
        Requests exclusive access to the card.
        Other process will not be able to access to the card until this access unlocked by calling endExclusive().
        Be sure to call endExclusive() to unlocked when exclusion is no longer needed.
        Throws:
        SmartCardException - if exclusive access has already been set or if exclusive access could not be established

      • endExclusive

        void endExclusive()
           throws SmartCardException
        Releases the exclusive access previously established using beginExclusive().
        Throws:
        SmartCardException - if the operation failed

      • enable

        void enable()
     throws SmartCardException
        Enables the SmartCardReader.
        Throws:
        SmartCardException - if the operation failed
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if already enabled

      • disable

        void disable()
      throws SmartCardException
        Disables the SmartCardReader. The SmartCardReader is suspended after disabled(). You need to excecute getSmartCardReaders() before excecute enable() again.
        Throws:
        SmartCardException - if the operation failed

      • getReaderName

        java.lang.String getReaderName()
        Gets the name of the SmartCardReader.
        Returns:
        The name of card reader.

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Checks if the SmartCardReader is enabled. (Status returned using state based on the API, not hardware state).
        Returns:
        true if SmartCardReader is already enabled. Otherwise return false.

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        Checks if the card is connected.
        Returns:
        true if card is already connected. Otherwise return false.

      • getStatusInfo

        SmartCardStatusInfo getStatusInfo()
                           throws SmartCardException
        Returns current status of the card. Return SmartCardStatusInfo object. See SmartCardStatusInfo section for details.
        Returns:
        SmartCardStatusInfo object. See SmartCardStatusInfo section for details.
        Throws:
        SmartCardException - communication error, connection errors or any other related errors.

      • getLastError

        int getLastError()
        Returns the status code of the last executed method. Return status code defined as SmartCardErrors.
        Returns:
        status code defined by SmartCardErrors.
